content.description: Two identical resistors, <math alttext="R sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mtext>R</mtext><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="R sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mtext>R</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>, each have resistance <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll"> <mi>R</mi> </math>. The resistors are connected in series with a battery. The potential difference across <math alttext="R sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mtext>R</mtext><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math> is <math alttext="delta V sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mstyle displaystyle="false"><mi>V</mi></mstyle><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>. <math alttext="R sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mtext>R</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math> is then replaced by different resistor with resistance <math alttext="2 R" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>R</mi></math>.
content.question: What is the potential difference across resistor \(\text{R}_{\text{1}}\) after \(\text{R}_{\text{2}}\) is replaced?

choices.label: <math alttext="one third delta V sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="one half delta V sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="two thirds delta V sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>2</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="two thirds delta V sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>2</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
